intro: Chrysanthemum tabrisianum, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and has cultural significance in countries like Japan and China. The leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn.
